### Prerequisites:

- Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.
- Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.
- You need a physical example of the device.

### Device Information

- Device Name: `Provide the name of the device`
- Device Model: `Provide the model number or identifier`
- Device Description: `Describe in short the functionality of the device`
- Link to device image: [Provide the URL to an image/photo of the device](https://www.url-to-images.com)

### Device Interview

```json
{
    [" Hola, Tengo un Homey Pro (Early 2023). Al a├▒adir un interruptor Moes/Tuya de 1 tecla, Homey lo reconoce como:

Manufacturer: _TZE200_amp6tsvy
ModelID: TS0601
Tipo: enddevice
IEEE: 84:fd:27_ff_fe_63_58_e3
El dispositivo se incluye, pero la tarjeta muestra ÔÇ£este dispositivo no puede encenderse ni apagarseÔÇØ. En Configuraci├│n avanzada no aparecen endpoints/clusters. He probado:

Quitar y volver a incluir desde la app ÔÇ£Tuya ZigbeeÔÇØ (Wall Switch 1 Gang y Switch Module 1 Gang).
Reset de f├íbrica del switch y emparejar a 1ÔÇô2 m de Homey, esperando a completar la entrevista.
Sigue sin exponer On/Off. Solicito que se a├▒ada soporte para el fingerprint de este modelo TS0601 (_TZE200_amp6tsvy) en la app Tuya Zigbee. Puedo aportar capturas y volver a emparejar si necesitan logs adicionales.

"]
}
```

### How to interview a device

- Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey
- Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee.
- Interview the device, the button for this is to the right of the device in the list of Zigbee units.
- Click the copy button/icon to capture the device information.
- Paste the copied information above.

> **Note:** To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

body:
### Describe the bug

I am using Smart water timer and it stopped working and I got error when I wanted to control this device few months ago, but I did not have time to investigate. I have identified issue now, It seems that someone wrongly deleted in library _TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js_  definition of "writeInteger" datapoint and value. Could you just please restore "async writeInteger" ? 

### To Reproduce

Steps to identify error:

1. Go to TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js  (https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/lib )
2. Search for writeInteger and please restore part which was wrongly deleted.
3. Why writeInteger? Because in device.js in https://github.com/eelco2k/com.tuya.zigbee/tree/f63c956857404d56cabcb2bfde30f716356e1979/drivers/smart_water_timer is using it and I am getting an error when I want to control Smart Water Timer.
4. then pls reinstall com.tuya.zigbee App
5. If no error could you please update it for everyone?

### App and Homey version

> * What Homey version are you running? Homey Pro (Early 2023) 12.5.2
> * What version of Homey firmware do you use? 12.5.2
> * What version of the Tuya Zigbee App are you using? 0.2.73 Development
title: Bug report - pls add missing writeInteger in TuyaSpecificClusterDevice.js

body:
### Probl├¿me : Le Paradoxe du Workflow (Catch-22)

Le workflow GitHub Actions sur la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` est bloqu├® dans un ├®tat de conflit insoluble.

1.  **Le workflow actuel est d├®fectueux** : Il tente une op├®ration `git rebase` qui ├®choue syst├®matiquement ├á cause de conflits profonds avec le d├®p├┤t `upstream`.
2.  **La correction est bloqu├®e** : Toute tentative de pousser un commit pour corriger le fichier de workflow d├®clenche le workflow d├®fectueux. Celui-ci ├®choue avant m├¬me que la correction ne puisse ├¬tre appliqu├®e.

Le workflow se sabote lui-m├¬me, emp├¬chant toute mise ├á jour.

### Solution : Contournement et Recr├®ation Manuelle

Pour briser ce cycle, la branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` doit ├¬tre supprim├®e et recr├®├®e manuellement sur GitHub ├á partir d'une source saine. Cette action n'est pas un commit et ne d├®clenchera donc pas le workflow d├®fectueux.

**├ëtapes de la r├®solution :**
1.  Une nouvelle branche saine (`jules-final-fix`) a ├®t├® cr├®├®e localement.
2.  Cette branche contient le workflow final "auto-r├®parateur", capable de g├®rer les futures synchronisations.
3.  La branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera supprim├®e de GitHub.
4.  Une nouvelle branche `powered-by-julesAI-2025` sera cr├®├®e ├á partir de `jules-final-fix`.

Cette proc├®dure garantit que la branche est saine et contient un workflow fonctionnel d├¿s sa cr├®ation.
title: fix(repo): R├®solution d├®finitive du conflit par recr├®ation de la branche

body:
### Probl├¿me

Le workflow GitHub Actions ├®choue syst├®matiquement ├á cause de conflits de `git rebase` avec le d├®p├┤t `upstream`. Les tentatives de correction via des scripts locaux n'ont pas r├®ussi ├á mettre ├á jour le fichier de workflow sur GitHub, entra├«nant des ├®checs r├®p├®t├®s.

### Solution

Le contenu du fichier `.github/workflows/tuya-zigbee-auto-contributions.yml` a ├®t├® remplac├® manuellement par une version corrig├®e et robuste.

#### Changements cl├®s :
- **Suppression du Rebase :** L'├®tape de synchronisation (`Sync with Upstream`) a ├®t├® modifi├®e pour ne faire qu'un `git fetch` sans tenter de `rebase` ou de `merge`. C'est l'action principale qui r├®sout le conflit.
- **Utilisation d'un PAT :** Le workflow utilise maintenant un Personal Access Token (`secrets.MY_PAT`) pour toutes les op├®rations Git et API, afin d'├®viter les probl├¿mes de permissions.
- **Am├®lioration du D├®bogage :** Des commandes `echo` ont ├®t├® ajout├®es ├á chaque ├®tape pour permettre un suivi clair de l'ex├®cution dans les logs.
- **Commit et Push s├®curis├®s :** La logique de commit a ├®t├® am├®lior├®e pour ne s'ex├®cuter que si des changements r├®els sont d├®tect├®s.
title: fix(workflow): R├®solution finale des conflits de rebase persistants

- Before requesting a device addition, please ensure there is not already a request for the device among the open issues.
- Make sure your Homey is upgraded to firmware v5 or higher.
- You need a physical example of the device.

### Device Information

- Device Name: _TZ3000_o4mkahkc
- Device Model: TS0202
- Device Description: Tuya Zigbee PIR motion sensor. Battery-powered (CR2450), wall- or ceiling-mountable, sends motion events and sometimes tamper or battery status.
- Link to device image: https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005007862729814.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.16.5fe179d2wHavE6&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld#nav-specification

### Device Interview

```json
{
  "ids": {
    "modelId": "TS0202",
    "manufacturerName": "_TZ3000_o4mkahkc"
  },
  "endpoints": {
    "1": {
      "clusters": {
        "input": [
          "genBasic",
          "genPowerCfg",
          "msOccupancySensing",
          "genIdentify"
        ],
        "output": [
          "genOta"
        ]
      },
      "bindings": [
        {
          "cluster": "genPowerCfg",
          "target": {
            "endpoint": 1,
            "ieeeAddress": "0x00158d000xxxxx",
            "type": "endpoint"
          }
        }
      ]
    }
  },
  "manufacturerName": "_TZ3000_o4mkahkc",
  "modelId": "TS0202",
  "applicationVersion": 66,
  "zclVersion": 3,
  "hardwareVersion": 1,
  "dateCode": "20220101",
  "powerSource": "Battery",
  "softwareBuildId": "1.0.6"
}
```

### Additional Comments:

> **Note: I bought the device via AliExpress:
https://nl.aliexpress.com/item/1005007862729814.html?spm=a2g0o.order_list.order_list_main.16.5fe179d2wHavE6&gatewayAdapt=glo2nld#nav-specification

This is a very common Tuya PIR motion sensor (TS0202 variant), but not yet matched by the current app. ItÔÇÖs detected as an unknown Zigbee device in Homey (even with the test version of the Tuya Zigbee app). Would love to have this added.

Thanks in advance!

### How to interview a device

- Add the device as a generic Zigbee device in Homey
- Navigate to https://developer.athom.com/tools/zigbee.
- Interview the device, the button for this is to the right of the device in the list of Zigbee units.
- Click the copy button/icon to capture the device information.
- Paste the copied information above.

> **Note:** To be able to add more devices to the Tuya Zigbee app, we rely on community members like you to provide interviews of the devices you want to be added. Thank you for your contribution!

body:
### Describe the bug

The soil sensor device _TZE284_aao3yzhs shows completely incorrect values for both humidity and temperature (67109121% and 67109120┬░C respectively), and battery information is not displayed at all. The device appears to be using the Tuya proprietary cluster format but the current driver is trying to interpret the data as standard Zigbee values, resulting in corrupted readings.

### To Reproduce

Steps to reproduce the behavior:
1. Go to 'Homey App' ÔåÆ 'Devices' ÔåÆ 'Add Device'
2. Select 'Tuya Zigbee' app
3. Choose 'Soil Sensor' (first option under soil sensors)
4. Pair the _TZE284_aao3yzhs device
5. View the device card in Homey
6. See incorrect values: Luftfuktighet: 67109121%, Temperatur: 67109120┬░C, Battery: no data

### Expected behavior

The device should display:
- Realistic soil moisture percentage (0-100%)
- Realistic temperature readings in Celsius
- Battery percentage or voltage information
- Proper battery alarm functionality when battery is low

### App and Homey version

- Homey Pro with firmware 7.4.2-0
- Tuya Zigbee App version v0.2.73Test

###

![Image](https://github.com/user-attachments/assets/f9f5b76f-1bca-455a-a33d-be03824ab9c7)

![Soil Sensor showing incorrect values](user-provided-screenshot-showing-67109121-percent-humidity-and-67109120-celsius-temperature)

The screenshot shows the device card displaying:
- Luftfuktighet: 67109121%
- Temperatur: 67109120┬░C  
- Batteri: (no data shown)
- Batterialarm: (no data shown)

### Additional context

- Device manufacturer/model: _TZE284_aao3yzhs (soil moisture sensor)
- This is a Tuya device that likely uses the proprietary Tuya cluster (0xEF00/61184) for data transmission
- The values 67109120/67109121 (0x04000000/0x04000001 in hex) suggest raw Tuya cluster data being misinterpreted as standard Zigbee values
- Device paired successfully but was automatically assigned to existing "Soil Sensor" driver which doesn't properly handle this specific manufacturer variant
- This is the first Tuya device being tested in this Homey setup
- Diagnostic ID available: d424bf60-018c-4bea-acff-0ff80c363c67
- The device requires specific driver support for _TZE284_aao3yzhs to properly decode Tuya proprietary data format

body:
Hey Johan, 

I have a strange problem. I just moved. and am busy to completely reinstall homey. I have completely reset it and start completely again. now I found out that my 2 gang switch module was added as an unknown zigbee device. this was strange because you had already provided this a long time ago and I have used it perfectly for several years. I discovered that I was not on the test version. so I thought clearly, especially after I saw the latest update of the normal version. now the strange thing is that when I install this it comes to homey but when I add any zigbee device it throws me back to the normal version. can you provide me with a solution?

Thx!
